thread.title: NFL: Ravens vs. Steelers ain’t what it used to be
thread.title_full: NFL: Ravens vs. Steelers ain’t what it used to be | Toronto Star

title: NFL: Ravens vs. Steelers ain’t what it used to be
text:
Baltimore (-2.5) at Pittsburgh
Ravens-Steelers games used to be the apex of violence in the NFL: just pure concussive car-accident mayhem hits, by badass human hammers on both sides of the ball. If you’ve ever been on a sideline of a professional football game, the sound of collisions seems to hit you; watching these games on TV was like that. Now, instead of being two Super Bowl contenders, the Ravens are 0-3 and the Steelers are without Ben Roethlisberger for a while, and the games feel much smaller, all in all.
The violence may remain, though.
Pick: Baltimore
Bruce Arthur
